questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Peru offers a breathtaking view of the Andes and was once a majestic Incan citadel?
questions.context: Discovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911, this site is known for its sophisticated dry-stone construction and has become an icon of Incan civilization.

questions.context: Standing at over 828 meters, this skyscraper features a neo-futuristic design by the architectural firm Skidmore, Owings & Merrill.

questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo marked a decisive victory for the Seventh Coalition against Napoleon Bonaparte.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in China includes a section of a historical wall stretching over 13,000 miles?
